content: this text is about a legal procedure called supplementary statement liquidationdivision joint ownership cost procedure it lasted for 4 years and 4 months and involved a case between mrs d and mr c mrs d has been ordered to pay mr c a sum of €18567068 additionally mrs d must pay a notary a sum of €1977032 while mr c must pay the same notary a sum of €1018471 the notary concludes that mrs d should transfer a total amount of €20544100 to the notarys account of which €17548597 will be transferred to mr c the text also provides a summary of the preliminary procedure and the difficulties faced by both parties in the division of joint ownership it includes details about the distribution of assets mortgage repayments housing allowance fire insurance repair costs and court fees the final decision approves the allocation and division of assets according to the law the notary reminds the interested parties to review a document called the bailiffs writ within one month and raise any objections a drawing of lots will take place in the absence or presence of the parties involved and any disputes or difficulties will be documented if the parties agree to the statement of liquidation and draft division it becomes final and may be approved by a competent court once approved the joint ownership between the parties ceases to exist the notary also mentions a fee of €50 that must be paid at their office
